TEXT.English: Banditry is a weak form of military, typically associated weak city-state governments. Bandits do not often form large groups and generally ignore the provisions of government. For these reasons it is nearly impossible to successfully base a powerful military off of bandits due to their solitary behavior and mistrust of all.
TEXT.French: Banditry is a weak form of military, typically associated weak city-state governments. Bandits do not often form large groups and generally ignore the provisions of government. For these reasons it is nearly impossible to successfully base a powerful military off of bandits due to their solitary behavior and mistrust of all.

TEXT.English: Conscription is a forced tour of duty in a military service. It is often employed where the ruler rules with absolute power over the civilian population. Because the service is generally not voluntary, many may find the military service disagreeable and lacking in quality.
TEXT.French: Conscription is a forced tour of duty in a military service. It is often employed where the ruler rules with absolute power over the civilian population. Because the service is generally not voluntary, many may find the military service disagreeable and lacking in quality.
TEXT.German: Conscription is a forced tour of duty in a military service. It is often employed where the ruler rules with absolute power over the civilian population. Because the service is generally not voluntary, many may find the military service disagreeable and lacking in quality.
TEXT.Italian: Conscription is a forced tour of duty in a military service. It is often employed where the ruler rules with absolute power over the civilian population. Because the service is generally not voluntary, many may find the military service disagreeable and lacking in quality.
TEXT.Spanish: Conscription is a forced tour of duty in a military service. It is often employed where the ruler rules with absolute power over the civilian population. Because the service is generally not voluntary, many may find the military service disagreeable and lacking in quality.

TEXT.English: A vassal is one who enters into mutual obligations with a monarch, usually of military support and mutual protection, in exchange for certain guarantees, which came to include the terrain held as a fief. By analogy it is applied to similar systems in other feudal societies. It was always distinct from fidelitas, sworn loyalty of subject to king, and the honor, the respect and consideration that accrued to the vassal, unlike the delegated power of a comes or count, was not expressed in expectations of related public duty.
TEXT.French: A vassal is one who enters into mutual obligations with a monarch, usually of military support and mutual protection, in exchange for certain guarantees, which came to include the terrain held as a fief. By analogy it is applied to similar systems in other feudal societies. TEXT.English: Standing Armies are large armies that remain always active for military service, regardless of the current diplomatic situation. Standing armies are useful when responding to quickly changing threats, but come at a high cost to the owner.
TEXT.French: Standing Armies are large armies that remain always active for military service, regardless of the current diplomatic situation. Standing armies are useful when responding to quickly changing threats, but come at a high cost to the owner.
TEXT.German: Standing Armies are large armies that remain always active for military service, regardless of the current diplomatic situation. Standing armies are useful when responding to quickly changing threats, but come at a high cost to the owner.
TEXT.Italian: Standing Armies are large armies that remain always active for military service, regardless of the current diplomatic situation. Standing armies are useful when responding to quickly changing threats, but come at a high cost to the owner.
TEXT.Spanish: Standing Armies are large armies that remain always active for military service, regardless of the current diplomatic situation. Standing armies are useful when responding to quickly changing threats, but come at a high cost to the owner.

TEXT.English: Volunteer armies are based completely off of volunteers. This has many advantages to the older conscription style armies, as volunteers are much more likely to be skilled and want to serve in the military, greatly improving morale. The largest downside is that during prolonged conflicts, volunteers may become scarce and the army size may dwindle.
TEXT.French: Volunteer armies are based completely off of volunteers. This has many advantages to the older conscription style armies, as volunteers are much more likely to be skilled and want to serve in the military, greatly improving morale. The largest downside is that during prolonged conflicts, volunteers may become scarce and the army size may dwindle.

The largest downside is that during prolonged conflicts, volunteers may become scarce and the army size may dwindle.

TEXT.English: Pacifism is the opposition to war or violence as a means of settling disputes or gaining advantage. Pacifism covers a spectrum of views ranging from the belief that international disputes can and should be peacefully resolved; to calls for the abolition of the institutions of the military and war; to opposition to any organization of society through governmental force; to rejection of the use of physical violence to obtain political, economic or social goals; to the condemnation of force except in cases where it is absolutely necessary to advance the cause of peace; to opposition to violence under any circumstance, including defense of self and others.
TEXT.French: Pacifism is the opposition to war or violence as a means of settling disputes or gaining advantage. Pacifism covers a spectrum of views ranging from the belief that international disputes can and should be peacefully resolved; to calls for the abolition of the institutions of the military and war; to opposition to any organization of society through governmental force; to rejection of the use of physical violence to obtain political, economic or social goals; to the condemnation of force except in cases where it is absolutely necessary to advance the cause of peace; to opposition to violence under any circumstance, including defense of self and others.
TEXT.German: Pacifism is the opposition to war or violence as a means of settling disputes or gaining advantage. TEXT.Italian: Pacifism is the opposition to war or violence as a means of settling disputes or gaining advantage. TEXT.Spanish: Pacifism is the opposition to war or violence as a means of settling disputes or gaining advantage. TEXT.English: Mutually Assured Destruction (M.A.D) is a doctrine of military strategy in which a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two opposing sides would effectively result in the destruction of both the attacker and the defender. It is based on the theory of deterrence according to which the development of strong weapons is essential to threaten the enemy in order to prevent the use of the very same weapons.
TEXT.French: Mutually Assured Destruction (M.A.D) is a doctrine of military strategy in which a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two opposing sides would effectively result in the destruction of both the attacker and the defender. It is based on the theory of deterrence according to which the development of strong weapons is essential to threaten the enemy in order to prevent the use of the very same weapons.
TEXT.German: Mutually Assured Destruction (M.A.D) is a doctrine of military strategy in which a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two opposing sides would effectively result in the destruction of both the attacker and the defender. It is based on the theory of deterrence according to which the development of strong weapons is essential to threaten the enemy in order to prevent the use of the very same weapons.
TEXT.Italian: Mutually Assured Destruction (M.A.D) is a doctrine of military strategy in which a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two opposing sides would effectively result in the destruction of both the attacker and the defender. It is based on the theory of deterrence according to which the development of strong weapons is essential to threaten the enemy in order to prevent the use of the very same weapons.
TEXT.Spanish: Mutually Assured Destruction (M.A.D) is a doctrine of military strategy in which a full-scale use of nuclear weapons by two opposing sides would effectively result in the destruction of both the attacker and the defender. It is based on the theory of deterrence according to which the development of strong weapons is essential to threaten the enemy in order to prevent the use of the very same weapons.

TEXT.English: Unmanned Warfare is the culmination of weapon science and pacifism. It allows the military to control operations remotely, without the potiental loss of life, or at least, friendly life.
TEXT.French: Unmanned Warfare is the culmination of weapon science and pacifism. It allows the military to control operations remotely, without the potiental loss of life, or at least, friendly life.
